DataElement.preferredName: Hysterectomy Surgical Procedure No Evidence Leiomyosarcoma Observed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown/not applicable regarding information related to an operation in which the uterus is removed for diagnostic or treatment reasons that shows no knowledge on which to base belief of an uncommon, aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, usually occurring in post-menopausal women being observed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hysterectomy Surgical Procedure No Evidence Leiomyosarcoma Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an operation in which the uterus is removed for diagnostic or treatment reasons that shows no knowledge on which to base belief of an uncommon, aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, usually occurring in post-menopausal women being observed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (hiss-ter-EK-toe-mee) An operation in which the uterus is removed.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:Knowledge on which to base belief.:An uncommon, aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, usually occurring in post-menopausal women. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells. Morphologic variants include epithelioid, granular cell, inflammatory and myxoid leimyosarcomas.:Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Knowledge on which to base belief.

An uncommon, aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, usually occurring in post-menopausal women.  It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.  Morphologic variants include epithelioid, granular cell, inflammatory and myxoid leimyosarcomas.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient had a "morcell
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient had a "morcellation" hysterectomy procedure that involved morcellation within the peritoneal cavity, was a second operation performed and do the biopsies from the second procedure show no evidence of leiomyosarcoma?
